newsitem.title: DUBAI: Airlift for million haj pilgrims begins in Saudi.
newsitem.headline: Airlift for million haj pilgrims begins in Saudi.

text.p: An airlift to take over a million haj pilgrims home from Saudi Arabia to 120 countries has begun and is due to be completed in a month, the Saudi daily Arab News said on Monday.
"The departure of pilgrims was authorised after the Ministry of Health declared the haj clean and free of any epidemics or contagious diseases," the English-language paper said.
Officials said about 1.2 million foreign pilgrims performed this year's haj.
Some 343 pilgrims were killed and over 1,000 injured during this year's haj when a fire swept through a tent complex at a key pilgrimage site.
Some 200,000 Indonesian pilgrims, the largest number from a single country, will be flown home on 940 flights at a rate of 20 flights a day on Garuda Indonesia airlines.
Pakistan International Airlines will carry most of the 125,000 Pakistani pilgrims home on 300 flights and Air India will start ferrying the 80,000 Indian pilgrims home on Monday , the newspaper said.
The paper said repatriation of pilgrims was due to be completed by May 18.
